radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT ABD & PELVIS W & W/O CONTRAST, ADDL SECTIONS

findings.lungs: Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.
findings.liver: Unremarkable except for multiple hemangiomas measuring up to 6 cm.
findings.pancreas: Normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
findings.spleen: Normal size and attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions.
findings.gastrointestinal: No intestinal obstruction. The appendix is distended with associated soft tissue strain. An appendicolith seen at its distal end.
findings.pelvis: No free fluid in the pelvis.
findings.lymph nodes: A few prominent right lower quadrant lymph nodes likely reactive. No pelvic lymphadenopathy.
findings.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. No atherosclerotic disease noted.
findings.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture. Foci of sclerotic bone seen in bilateral femoral heads, likely representing bone islands.
findings.soft tissue: Abdominal and pelvic wall within normal limits.
